other_tests.findings: Histologic examination demonstrated a compound SN with symmetric proliferation of large epithelioid and polygonal melanocytes arranged in uniform nests.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One year later, two additional nevi were biopsied with similar microscopic features. Several additional nevi developed over time, diagnosed histologically as junctional SN.

other_tests.findings: Histopathologic examination revealed SN with atypical features (category II).
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient has gradually developed new melanocytic nevi over 20 years, with no sudden increases in number.

other_tests.findings: In 6 cases, there was a small component of residual SN plus scar in the re-excision specimen; in the remaining 11 cases, there was no residual lesion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: To date, none of the re-excised lesions have recurred.

other_tests.findings: Showed no chromosomal gains or losses in two of the ASN.
